Title: God ready to intervene in Nigeria’s challenges — Pastor Muoka
Summary: Pastor Lazarus Muoka is General Overseer of The Lord’s Chosen Charismatic Revival Ministries . He says God is set to deliver Nigerians from economic, social, and spiritual challenges .

Title: Alleged False Claim: Senator Natasha pleads not guilty to FG’s 3-count charge
Summary: The embattled lawmaker was earlier handed a six-month suspension by the Senate . He was docked before a High Court of the Federal Capital Territory (FCT) sitting at Maitama .

Title: Senator Natasha arrives Abuja court with husband
Summary: The Federal Government is currently prosecuting Natasha in two courts for allegedly defaming Bello and Akpabio . Natasha arrives Abuja court with husband .

Title: 2 women docked for allegedly fighting in public
Summary: Two women, Mariam Olajimoke, 52 and Esther Oladipupupo, 54, were on Thursday docked in an Iyaganku Magistrates’ Court, Ibadan, for allegedly fighting in public .

Title: Israel’s Netanyahu says Iran will ‘pay heavy price’ after hospital hit
Summary: Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said Iran would "pay a heavy price" after a hospital in southern Israel was hit during an Iranian missile attack . Defence minister said Iran's supreme leader would be "held accountable"

Title: NAF destroys terrorists’ IED factory, gun trucks in Borno
Summary: Nigerian Air Force has destroyed an explosive devices factory, terrorist gun trucks, and eliminated dozens of fighters in Kwaltiri, within the Tumbuktu Triangle area of Borno . This was contained in a statement by the Director, Public Relations and Information, NAF, Air Commodore Ehimen Ejodame, on Thursday in Abu

Title: First HoldCo commits to dividend payment despite forbearance
Summary: First HoldCo is one of the banks impacted by the directive of the Central Bank of Nigeria, which froze dividend payment, bonuses, and investments in foreign subsidiaries for lenders operating under regulatory forbearance . The lender has committed to paying a dividend in the 2025 financial year and beyond despite its forbearance exposure .

Title: NSCDC boss condemns 'barbaric' Benue killings, vows justice
Summary: Commandant General of the Nigeria Security and Civil Defence Corps, Dr. Ahmed Audi, condemned the recent killing of civilians in Benue State, describing the attack as barbaric and unjustifiable . His on-the-spot assessment visit followed last Friday’s massacre in Yelewata community in Guma Local Government Area of Benue

Title: Ben Murray-Bruce predicts World War III, says Nigeria'll be safe haven for survivors
Summary: Founder of the Silverbird Group, Ben Murray-Bruce has suggested that a future global conflict will devastate much of the world but leave Africa, and particularly Nigeria, unscathed . In a live interview with a Global Affairs Expert, Dane Waters, on Tuesday, the former senator stated that a war is “inevitable”

Title: US resumes student visas, orders applicants to make social media public
Summary: Applicants for F (academic), M (vocational), and J (exchange) nonimmigrant visas will undergo more intensive screening, including a review of their online presence . The department noted that a US visa is “a privilege, not a right,” and that visa adjudications are national security decisions .
